title: Calories in In-N-Out Fries
meta_description: Discover calories in n out fries for one standard serving, including full nutrition breakdown, macros, sodium, and preparation tweaks for better choices.
assumptions: Standard In-N-Out french fries, one order (~125 g), fresh-cut, cooked in 100% cholesterol-free vegetable oil, no added toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by location, portion size, oil used, and customizations; check In-N-Out app or menu for latest values.

quick_answer.text: One serving of In-N-Out fries has ~370 kcal, 51 g carbs, and 17 g fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: Animal style (add cheese, grilled onions, and spread)
Baked at home (air-fried version, no oil)

faqs.q: How many calories in n out fries per serving?
faqs.a: One standard serving of In-N-Out fries contains 370 calories.

faqs.q: What are the macros for In-N-Out fries?
faqs.a: 51 g carbs, 17 g fat (3 g saturated), 6 g protein, and 5 g fiber per serving.

faqs.q: Are In-N-Out fries high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, about 260 mg sodium per serving, mainly from the potatoes and seasoning.

faqs.q: Do In-N-Out fries have trans fats?
faqs.a: No trans fats (0 g) as they use cholesterol-free vegetable oil.

faqs.q: How do animal style n out fries change calories?
faqs.a: Adding cheese, onions, and spread increases calories to around 710 per serving.
